name: Forest of Mercia Timberland Trail (Short Route)

ai.summary: The Forest of Mercia Timberland Trail (Short Route) is an 18.5 km challenging hike through UK woodlands, featuring dense forest, uneven single-track paths, and multiple climbs with rugged terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect rugged forest trails with exposed roots, muddy sections after rain, and uneven footing. Ground may be damp and uneven, with occasional rocky sections and short ascents; navigation relies on waymarkers and maps.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a full-day hike. Check the forecast and weather conditions; wear sturdy waterproof footwear and bring a waterproof layer. Carry a map and compass or a GPS device, and do not rely on mobile signal. Start early to avoid darkness and bring a headlamp or torch. Stay hydrated and carry enough water and high-energy snacks. Follow local signage, stay on marked paths, and tell someone your planned route and return time. Carry a whistle for emergencies and a basic first aid kit; know how to respond to common injuries.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Whistle and basic first aid kit
Mobile phone with offline map (fully charged)

seo.title: Forest of Mercia Timberland Trail (Short Route) – 18.5 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the challenging 18.5 km Forest of Mercia Timberland Trail, Short Route in the UK. Tough woodland terrain, variable weather, and practical safety and gear tips.
